definition: to provide (items for an event)/to cater/to make preparations
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: That caterer furnishes both food and maids.
sentences.chinese: 那个备办宴席者供给食物与招待。

sentences.english: Her mother provides breakfast every morning.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲每天早上备办早餐。

sentences.english: I'll invite people if you can organise food and drinks.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能备办饮食，我就负责请人。

definition: the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to prepare/to arrange (sth to be offered)
(religion) to sacrifice/sacrifice/animal offered as sacrifice
to purchase/to buy
kill the chickens and butcher the geese (idiom)
food and drink
offering
to kill the pigs and slaughter the sheep (idiom)
the New Year festival
wedding banquet/congratulatory feast
feast/banquet
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
wine and meat/food and drink
bride's family (in marriage)
to pay respects during a festival
